original_solution_mapping.L1: Bobby ate 5 pancakes and his dog ate 7 so 5+7 = <<5+7=12>>12
original_solution_mapping.L2: The recipe makes 21 pancakes and 12 were eaten so 21-12 = <<21-12=9>>9 pancakes were left

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3641.
    Returns: the number of pancakes Bobby has left.
    """
    # L1
    bobby_ate = 5 # he ate 5 pancakes
    dog_ate = 7 # his dog jumped up and was able to eat 7
    total_eaten = bobby_ate + dog_ate

    # L2
    recipe_makes = 21 # The recipe on the box makes 21 pancakes
    pancakes_left = recipe_makes - total_eaten

    # FA
    answer = pancakes_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bobby ate {bobby_ate} pancakes and his dog ate {dog_ate} so {bobby_ate}+{dog_ate} = <<{bobby_ate}+{dog_ate}={total_eaten}>>{total_eaten}
The recipe makes {recipe_makes} pancakes and {total_eaten} were eaten so {recipe_makes}-{total_eaten} = <<{recipe_makes}-{total_eaten}={pancakes_left}>>{pancakes_left} pancakes were left

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Bobby ate 7 pancakes and his dog ate 7 so 7+7 = <<7+7=14>>14
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The recipe makes 21 pancakes and 14 were eaten so 21-14 = <<21-14=7>>7 pancakes were left

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'dog_ate' (7) was used instead of 'bobby_ate' (5).
